items.title: Harvard has $2.2 billion in grants frozen by Trump administration after rejecting demands
items.description: The Trump administration has zeroed in on colleges in a crackdown on diversity, equity and inclusion programs in the United States.

items.title: Trump is 'shredding' credibility with allies while China benefits, former national security advisor John Bolton says
items.description: "We're having a war with our friends and really crippling our ability to deal effectively with China," Bolton told CNBC.

items.title: Singapore announces general election on May 3, dissolves parliament
items.description: This will be Singapore's 14th general election since independence, and will be Wong's first general election as prime minister.

items.title: Trump administration says it lacks authority to get Abrego Garcia back from El Salvador
items.description: A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to provide daily updates on efforts to recover Kilmar Abrego Garcia from an El Salvador prison.

items.title: U.S. businesses sue to block Trump tariffs, say trade deficits are not an emergency
items.description: The Trump administration's argument is undercut by its imposing tariffs on countries the U.S. does not have a trade deficit with, the plaintiffs say.
